actions.text: Read second time and referred jointly to Senate Committees on Budget; Governmental Affairs by unanimous consent pursuant to the order of August 4, 1977.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from GAO; CBO; Agriculture Department; Energy Department; Commerce Department; Health and Human Services Department.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from Education Department; Housing and Urban Development Department; Interior Department; Justice Department.
Committee on Governmental Affairs requested executive comment from Labor Department; State Department; Transportation Department; Treasury Department.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from Health and Human Services Department; OMB.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from Agriculture Department.
Committee on Governmental Affairs received executive comment from State Department.

official_title: A bill to amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to mandate pilot testing of major new federal programs.

summary.text: Amends the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to prohibit, beginning with fiscal year 1982, any new program costing $10,000,000 or more in any fiscal year from being implemented until such program has been tested on a pilot basis for at least one year with an expenditure of not more than ten percent of the highest annual budget outlay for such program authorized by Congress or estimated by the Congressional Budget Office for any fiscal year.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 to mandate pilot testing of major new federal programs.
